info.name: Almir Homebrew: Magical Armors, Weapons, and Items
info.description: A collection of magical weapons, armors, and items found by the PCs of the Almir campaign.
info.author: Salty Coffee

description.p: A simple silver chain adorned with a diamond-shaped pendant with a small amethyst set in the center. While attuned to the amulet, you can summon a spectral homunculus that will obey your commands and, to the best of its ability, complete simple tasks for 1 hour. Once the homunculus has been summoned, it cannot be summoned again until you finish a long rest.

A well-built spyglass, wrapped in a soft leather grip and made of a dark mahogany wood. This particular tool is imbued with a particularly potent abjuration charm that makes it impervious to any sort of damage.
When speaking the command word, the wearer is placed under the effects of the water walk spell.

Curse. This item is cursed. Placing it on your finger curses you until you are targeted by a remove curse spell or similar magic. As long as you remain cursed, you cannot remove the ring. After having spoken the command word to activate its magic, if the ring is not submerged, it gains weight rapidly, pulling the wearer back underwater. This lasts until the ring has been dry for 1d10 minutes.
While wearing this silver circlet inset with a single sparkling gem, you have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. The area is illuminated as if bathed in starlight.

element.name: Amulet of Canine Transformation
element.p: This unadorned, weathered chain sports a heavy clasp and a simple pendant depicting a canine-like creature. Upon being clasped around the neck of a creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be polymorphed into a dog. The creature can repeat the save at dawn of the next day until they succeed on the saving throw. While transformed, the creature retains its mental statistics, but cannot write, speak, use weapons or items, or cast any spells.
If the chain is broken or removed forcefully before the creature succeeds on its Wisdom saving throw, it takes 1d10 psychic damage before reverting to its original form.

description.p: These strange speckled beans hold within them the raw chaotic potential of Ploink, the Goddess of Chaos. When ingested, the DM rolls 1d10000 and enacts the effect listed on the Expanded Wild Magic table.
As an action while holding this gem in one hand, you can grant yourself tremorsense out to 30 feet. This special sight fades if you are no longer holding the gem in one hand.

element.name: Healing Potion of Hill Giant Strength

description.p: You regain 2d4 + 2 hit points when you drink this potion. Additionally, your Strength score is set to 21 for 1 hour. When agitated, the potion's syrupy greenish liquid glints with small flashes of phospholuminescence.
This potion was given to the human known as Barnacle by a servant of Ploink, the Goddess of Chaos. Its bright azure fluid smells of the sea and has a jellyfish-like bubble floating in it.

Upon imbibing this potion, you can breathe underwater for 1 hour. However, due to the nature of its origin, anyone who drinks this potion and was not its original recipient will cause its chaotic magic to manifest in potentially dangerous ways.

During the battle against the void-corrupted Madeline in the bowels of Dun'Morach, Alton High-Hill was granted an unexpected communion with his god Milil, the Lord of All Songs. The troubadour god imparted upon him the knowledge of the fluidity of fate—how his story, as well as those of his companions, had been inexplicably changed by forces beyond the mortal realm. However, the god urged Alton to embrace this new story, to make it one truly worth telling, and granted him this sword as a boon to assist to that endeavor.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

This sword has 2 charges. When you hit a creature with it, you can expend one charge to add an extra 1d8 radiant damage to the attack. The sword regains all expended charges after completing a long rest.

This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. In addition, the weapon has the thrown property with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. When used to make a ranged attack, it returns to the wielder’s hand immediately after a hit, but the wielder must use a bonus action to recall it should the attack miss.
